    • Method Detail

      • getRandomSplitsForInDomainTrainingExperiment

        public static java.util.List<ExampleSplit> getRandomSplitsForInDomainTrainingExperiment(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                                                                                        java.util.function.Function<Example,ExampleCategory> exampleToCategory,
                                                                                        Domain domain,
                                                                                        java.util.Random rand,
                                                                                        int foldsNum)
        Parameters:
        examples - only examples from 'domain' are considered.
        Returns:
        'foldsNum' splits, each containing all examples in 'examples' that their domain is 'domain'. The splits are the ones we get from K-fold cross validation stratified on example category.

      • getRandomSplitForZeroShotExperiment

        public static ExampleSplit getRandomSplitForZeroShotExperiment(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                                                               Domain testDomain,
                                                               java.util.Random rand)
        Returns:
        a random (i.e. shuffled) split containing all examples in 'examples' s.t. the training examples are NOT in 'testDomain' and the test examples are.

      • getAllExamples

        public java.util.stream.Stream<Example> getAllExamples()

      • shuffleOrders

        public void shuffleOrders(java.util.Random rand)

      • createRandomly

        public static ExampleSplit createRandomly(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                                          double trainRatio,
                                          java.util.Random rand,
                                          boolean sameWorkerExamplesStayTogether)
        Parameters:
        trainRatio - the ratio between train examples # and total examples #, so it's in the range [0,1]. The test ratio will be 1-trainRatio.

      • getSubsetByFilteringExamples

        public ExampleSplit getSubsetByFilteringExamples(@Nullable
                                                 ExampleSplit.SplitPart splitPartToFilter,
                                                 java.util.function.Predicate<Example> predicate)
        Parameters:
        predicate - examples that this predicates returns true for are kept.
        splitPartToFilter - if not null, only example in this part of the split are subject to being filtered out.
        Returns:
        a subset of this split. The example collections are not shared with this object.

      • getSubsetContainedInExampleCollection

        public ExampleSplit getSubsetContainedInExampleCollection(java.util.Collection<Example> c)
        Returns:
        A subset of this split, containing only examples in 'c' (their order is preserved).

      • getSubsetNotContainedInExampleCollection

        public ExampleSplit getSubsetNotContainedInExampleCollection(java.util.Collection<Example> c)
        Returns:
        A subset of this split, containing only examples not in 'c' (their order is preserved).

      • getSubsetNotContainingMultiSentenceExamples

        public ExampleSplit getSubsetNotContainingMultiSentenceExamples()
        Returns:
        The example collections are not shared with this object.

      • getSubsetContainingSingleExample

        public ExampleSplit getSubsetContainingSingleExample(java.lang.String exId)

      • addSplits

        public static ExampleSplit addSplits(ExampleSplit split1,
                                     ExampleSplit split2,
                                     @Nullable
                                     java.util.Random rand)
        Input splits are not modified.
        Parameters:
        rand - if null then no shuffling occurs and the order is preserved: 'split1' and then 'split2'. Otherwise, the orders are shuffled using 'rand'.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Example ex)
        Returns:
        true iff ex is either in the train or test sets.

      • getTrainExamples

        public java.util.ArrayList<Example> getTrainExamples()

        public java.util.ArrayList<Example> getTestExamples()

      • getSplitPart

        @Nullable
public ExampleSplit.SplitPart getSplitPart(Example ex)
        Returns:
        null iff 'ex' is not in either part of this split.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:

      • createRandomTrainDevSplitsForKFoldCrossValidationStratifiedOnExampleCategory

        public static java.util.ArrayList<ExampleSplit> createRandomTrainDevSplitsForKFoldCrossValidationStratifiedOnExampleCategory(java.util.List<Example> examples,
                                                                                                                             int foldsNum,
                                                                                                                             java.util.function.Function<Example,ExampleCategory> exampleToCategory,
                                                                                                                             java.util.Random rand,
                                                                                                                             boolean sameWorkerExamplesStayTogether)
        The random separation to (almost) equal-sized folds is done per ExampleCategory.
        Parameters:
        examples - the examples to be used for each of the returned splits.
        Returns:
        random train-dev folds. Each fold is a random split (also randomly shuffled) containing all examples in 'examples').
